title: Temporal Counterfactual Explanations of Behaviour Tree Decisions
summary: This paper explores the explainability of robot decision-making controlled by behavior trees, specifically focusing on generating temporal counterfactual explanations to answer "why" questions about robot actions.
usefulness_reason: The title explicitly mentions "Temporal Counterfactual Explanations" and the summary discusses "temporal aspects of robot behavior", directly relating to the 'Temporal' part of the query. While not directly about spatio-temporal point processes, the strong temporal focus makes it relevant.
